member.name: P:System.Formats.Tar.GnuTarEntry.AccessTime
member.summary: A timestamp that represents the last time the file represented by this entry was accessed.

member.name: P:System.Formats.Tar.GnuTarEntry.ChangeTime

member.name: T:System.Formats.Tar.PosixTarEntry
member.summary: Defines the core behavior of a tar entry from an archive of a format that is based on the POSIX IEEE P1003.1 standard from 1988. This includes the formats (represented by the class), (represented by the class), and (represented by the class).

member.name: P:System.Formats.Tar.PosixTarEntry.DeviceMajor
member.summary: Gets or sets the device's major number. When the current entry represents a character device or a block device, the major number identifies the driver associated with the device.
member.exception: The entry does not represent a block device or a character device.
The value is negative, or larger than 2097151.

member.name: P:System.Formats.Tar.PosixTarEntry.DeviceMinor
member.summary: Gets or sets the device's minor number. When the current entry represents a character device or a block device, the minor number is used by the driver to distinguish individual devices it controls.
member.exception: The entry does not represent a block device or a character device.
The value is negative, or larger than 2097151.

member.name: P:System.Formats.Tar.PosixTarEntry.GroupName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the group that owns this entry.

member.name: P:System.Formats.Tar.PosixTarEntry.UserName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the user that owns this entry.

member.name: T:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntry
member.summary: Defines the core behavior of a tar entry from an archive.

member.name: M:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntry.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current entry.

member.name: P:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntry.Checksum
member.summary: The checksum of all the fields in this entry. The value is non-zero either when the entry is read from an existing archive, or after the entry is written to a new archive.

member.name: P:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntry.DataStream
member.summary: Gets or sets the data section of this entry. If the does not support containing data, then returns .
member.exception: Setting a data section is not supported because the is not (or for an archive of format).
The stream does not support reading.

returns.para: Gets a stream that represents the data section of this entry.

Sets a new stream that represents the data section, if it makes sense for the to contain data. If a stream already exists, the old stream is disposed before substituting it with the new stream. Setting a stream is allowed.

member.name: P:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntry.EntryType
member.summary: Gets the type of filesystem object represented by this entry.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the group that owns the file represented by this entry.

member.name: P:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntry.Length

member.name: P:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntry.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the Unix file permissions of the file represented by this entry.

member.name: F:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.Directory
member.summary: Directory.

summary.para: GNU directory with a list of entries.

member.name: F:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.HardLink
member.summary: Hard link.

summary.para: This entry type is specific to the format and is not supported for writing.
This entry type is specific to the , and formats.

to include the base directory name as the first path segment in all the names of the archive entries. to exclude the base directory name from the entry name paths.

member.name: T:System.Formats.Tar.TarReader
member.summary: Reads a tar archive from a stream.

member.name: M:System.Formats.Tar.TarReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a instance that can read tar entries from the specified stream, and can optionally leave the stream open upon disposal of this instance.
member.param: The stream to read from.
to dispose the when this instance is disposed; to leave the stream open.

member.name: M:System.Formats.Tar.TarReader.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the current instance, and disposes the streams of all the entries that were read from the archive if the leaveOpen argument was set to in the constructor.

member.name: M:System.Formats.Tar.TarReader.DisposeAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously disposes the current instance, and closes the streams of all the entries that were read from the archive if the leaveOpen argument was set to in the constructor.
member.returns: A value task that represents the asynchronous dispose operation.

member.name: M:System.Formats.Tar.TarReader.GetNextEntry(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the next entry from the archive stream.

param.name: copyData
param.para: to copy the data of the entry into a new . This is helpful when the underlying archive stream is unseekable, and the data needs to be accessed later.
if the data should not be copied into a new stream. If the underlying stream is unseekable, the user has the responsibility of reading and processing the immediately after calling this method.

member.exception:
The entry's data is malformed.
-or-
The archive contains entries in different formats.
-or-
More than one global extended attributes entry was found in the current archive.
-or-
Two or more extended attributes entries were found consecutively in the current archive.
member.returns: A instance if a valid entry was found, or if the end of the archive has been reached.

member.name: M:System.Formats.Tar.TarReader.GetNextEntryAsync(System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously retrieves the next entry from the archive stream.

param.name: copyData
param.para: to copy the data of the entry into a new . This is helpful when the underlying archive stream does not support seeking, and the data needs to be accessed later.

if the data should not be copied into a new stream. If the underlying stream does not support seeking, the user has the responsibility of reading and processing the immediately after calling this method.

member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.exception:
The archive is malformed.
-or-
The archive contains entries in different formats.
-or-
More than one Global Extended Attributes Entry was found in the current archive.
-or-
Two or more Extended Attributes entries were found consecutively in the current archive.
member.returns: A value task containing a instance if a valid entry was found, or if the end of the archive has been reached.

to dispose the when this instance is disposed; to leave the stream open.
